proof:
Proof. By Proposition 10 and Lemma 35, there exists a real $A > 0$ such that for all $d$ large enough, whp, any connected set $|S|$ with size at least $A\log(n)/d$ has $\mathrm{degg}(S) > \frac{9d}{10}|S|$, and if furthermore $|S| \le \frac{n}{6}$, then $e_G(S) \le (1+\frac{1}{5})|S|$.
Since $\mathrm{degg}(S) = 2e_G(S) + |E_G(S,S^c)|$, we can rearrange to get the ratio of internal edges, $\frac{2e_G(S)}{\mathrm{degg}(S)} = 1 + \frac{|E_G(S,S^c)|}{\mathrm{degg}(S)}$. Using the inequalities, we can bound the term on the right. For any connected set $S$, $|E_G(S,S^c)| \ge 1$, and for $d$ large enough $\mathrm{degg}(S)$ is positive, so we have
$$
\frac{e_G(S)}{\mathrm{degg}(S)} \ge \frac{3}{5}.
$$
For all $d$ large enough, this is at most $\frac{3}{5}$. To finish the proof, note that whenever $|S| \ge \frac{n}{6}$, its total degree is at least $\frac{3dn}{10}$. But whp $\frac{3nd}{10} > |E_G| > |E_c|$, giving $\frac{\mathrm{degg}(V_c)}{10} < \frac{3nd}{10} < \mathrm{degg}(S)$. Thus whenever $S$ has $\mathrm{degg}(S) \le \mathrm{degg}(V_c)/10$, then also $|S| \le n/6$, thus the exansion applies.
